content.question: Which of the following is a piece of evidence used by Brown to support his argument about the highly centralized states discussed in the excerpt?

choices.label: Atlantic trade was not the only focus of elites in West Africa.
European enterprise in the Americas depended on enslaved African labor.
Firearms began to arrive in the Gold and Slave Coasts of West Africa in large numbers by the eighteenth century.
African traders in the Senegambia first traded enslaved people with Europeans in the mid-sixteenth century.

content.answer: Firearms began to arrive in the Gold and Slave Coasts of West Africa in large numbers by the eighteenth century.

topic.text: 2.3: Capture and the Impact of the Slave Trade on West African Societies
